description: Probably of imitative origin; perhaps from ch(irp) + (y)elp.

verbs.description: chelp (third-person singular simple present chelps, present participle chelping, simple past and past participle chelped)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, Northern England) To gossip, particularly in a forthright manner.
examples: He's not here so we are chelping in the staffroom and ignoring the to-do list on the board.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, Northern England) To speak rudely or out of turn.
examples: The teacher got angry at all her chelping.
